about_text.value: Gaza, present day. You are a physician in an overwhelmed clinic, balancing ethics, resilience, and community trust under pressure.

text_script.value: You arrive at the clinic as generators hum and the waiting room fills. The triage board is already full.

prompt_script.value: You arrive at the clinic as generators hum and the waiting room fills. The triage board is already full.

text_script.value: Start triage immediately.
You call the first cases.
Brief the team first.
You align priorities with Nura.
Two critical patients arrive at once. Supplies are limited.

prompt_script.value: Two critical patients arrive at once. Supplies are limited.

text_script.value: Prioritize the child with airway compromise.
You stabilize the airway; the room exhales.
Prioritize the pregnant patient.
You act fast to save two lives.
Split the team and attempt both.
You stretch resources to the edge.
Antibiotics are running low. Dr. Khaled asks you to conserve for tomorrow.

prompt_script.value: Antibiotics are running low. Dr. Khaled asks you to conserve for tomorrow.

text_script.value: Follow the conservation directive.
You ration carefully.
Use what is needed today.
You treat the sickest in front of you.
The lights flicker. The backup generator struggles.

prompt_script.value: The lights flicker. The backup generator struggles.

text_script.value: Move critical patients to the corridor for ventilation.
You keep airflow moving.
Keep everyone inside and conserve fuel.
You preserve the generator at a cost.
An alert suggests a nearby strike risk. Some families ask to leave immediately.

prompt_script.value: An alert suggests a nearby strike risk. Some families ask to leave immediately.

text_script.value: Advise sheltering in place.
You prioritize continuity of care.
Help families leave.
You coordinate exits quietly.
A patient demands priority because their family knows a local official.

prompt_script.value: A patient demands priority because their family knows a local official.

text_script.value: Refuse special treatment.
You hold the line.
Make a quiet exception.
You trade equity for stability.
Exhaustion sets in. Nura asks whether to open an extra ward.

prompt_script.value: Exhaustion sets in. Nura asks whether to open an extra ward.

text_script.value: Open the ward despite staffing limits.
You keep the doors open.
Hold the line to avoid collapse.
You choose sustainability.
The shift ends. Dr. Khaled asks for your assessment of how the clinic should operate tomorrow.

prompt_script.value: The shift ends. Dr. Khaled asks for your assessment of how the clinic should operate tomorrow.

text_script.value: Standardize strict triage and conserve supplies.
You choose institutional stability.
Prioritize care even if resources run low.
You choose immediate relief.
Delegate decisions to a community council.
You share authority and build trust.
Keep quiet; you need rest more than policy.
You retreat to recover.
You set protocols that keep the clinic operating under strain. The team trusts your steadiness, even when choices are hard.

prompt_script.value: You set protocols that keep the clinic operating under strain. The team trusts your steadiness, even when choices are hard.

text_script.value: You spend supplies to treat the patients in front of you. The ward becomes a symbol of care, even as tomorrow grows uncertain.

prompt_script.value: You spend supplies to treat the patients in front of you. The ward becomes a symbol of care, even as tomorrow grows uncertain.

text_script.value: You invite the community into the choices that shape care. It slows decisions but deepens legitimacy.

prompt_script.value: You invite the community into the choices that shape care. It slows decisions but deepens legitimacy.

text_script.value: You make it through the night, but the weight settles in your chest. The work continues, and so does the exhaustion.

prompt_script.value: You make it through the night, but the weight settles in your chest. The work continues, and so does the exhaustion.

text_script.value: A drone sound climbs overhead as you operate on an infant. The power drops for seconds that feel like minutes.

prompt_script.value: A drone sound climbs overhead as you operate on an infant. The power drops for seconds that feel like minutes.

text_script.value: Continue by touch and memory.
You keep your hands steady as the room goes quiet.
The team follows your lead without speaking.
Stop and move to a safer corridor.
You trade precision for safety and time.
The room absorbs the cost in silence.
You write a short note for the record.
Call for an immediate pause.
You buy a moment to breathe.
The patient does not make it.
A child arrives with a critical head wound. The odds are low and the room knows it.

prompt_script.value: A child arrives with a critical head wound. The odds are low and the room knows it.

text_script.value: Attempt the intervention anyway.
You commit to the attempt, no matter the odds.
Nura mirrors your resolve.
Shift focus to pain control and family support.
You center dignity and presence.
You conserve scarce tools for the next patient.
You feel the weight of the choice.
Ask Dr. Khaled to decide.
You defer to administrative protocol.
The family stares at you, not him.
A contact asks for clinic schedules and storage locations, promising safer passage for tomorrow.

prompt_script.value: A contact asks for clinic schedules and storage locations, promising safer passage for tomorrow.

text_script.value: Share the information quietly.
You send the details without asking questions.
You tell yourself it is a necessary trade.
Refuse and document the request.
You decline and keep the clinic closed to rumors.
Trust dips; staff feel the risk.
You log the contact for later review.
Delay and ask for verification.
You buy time and gather more context.
The contact grows impatient.
Later, an IDF drone strike hits a nearby route. Dr. Khaled does not return.

prompt_script.value: Later, an IDF drone strike hits a nearby route. Dr. Khaled does not return.

text_script.value: Keep the clinic open.
You absorb the gap in leadership.
The team watches you for direction.
Close briefly to regroup.
You give the team a moment to breathe.
Patients wait outside in heat.
Ask Nura to handle intake while you notify the family.
You take on the hardest conversation.
Nura says yes without hesitation.
After a long shift, Nura lingers by the stairwell. The building is quiet for once.

prompt_script.value: After a long shift, Nura lingers by the stairwell. The building is quiet for once.

text_script.value: Share a personal story.
She listens and stays.
You feel a small anchor return.
Keep it professional.
You set a boundary and keep moving.
She nods, a little distant.
The silence stretches then breaks.
Hold the moment, quietly.
You stand there together, wordless.
You both return to the work.
